s.text: "I think we have to go back to Van Buren to find a vice president who succeeded as the president."
"I think we have to go back to Van Buren to find a vice president who succeeded as the president."
As sound bites go, this was just about perfect, a tiny dagger pitched into Gore's sternum.
Part of the fun of watching Moynihan is that you seldom have any idea what he will say next--and neither does he.
Moynihan then quoted a passage from the book in which Bradley praises ... Moynihan.
Once the floor was opened to questions, a reporter asked Moynihan, "What's wrong with Mr. Gore?"
Once the floor was opened to questions, a reporter asked Moynihan, "What's wrong with Mr. Gore?"
"Do you want a list?" he asked, to more tumultuous laughter and applause.
Once the floor was opened to questions, a reporter asked Moynihan, "What's wrong with Mr. Gore?"
Once the floor was opened to questions, a reporter asked Moynihan, "What's wrong with Mr. Gore?"
